channel.title: Silabsoft-Style Client
channel.description:
Hello forum!
I've been away for a few years, but I kinda wanna get back into playing around with private servers as a pass-time. I notice now that Silabsoft is down, however. I was wondering if there is an alternative (preferably, but not necessarily, blank) which harbours all the same weapons/items/NPCs available. 317.
Many thanks!

item.title: Silabsoft-Style Client
item.dc:creator: @Shadowswoz Shadowswoz
item.description:
@Shadowswoz wrote:

Spades:

It wouldn’t even be difficult to start from scratch. There are plenty of tutorials that will teach you how to add 474+ models into your client. Plus it is a good learning experience

If I were to do this, is there a particular client you would suggest I work off?

Ruby:

PM her, she might still have an old one lying around or check out silabsoft.org for one kicking around.

I’ll give it a shot.

Thanks both.

Read full topic

item.title: Silabsoft-Style Client
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:3, topic:544979”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=663858.msg4437212#msg4437212 date=1405482592]
PM her, she might still have an old one lying around or check out silabsoft.org for one kicking around.
[/quote]

She isn’t going to give her client away. I know there are clients out there that have what you’re looking for. It wouldn’t even be difficult to start from scratch. There are plenty of tutorials that will teach you how to add 474+ models into your client. Plus it is a good learning experience :D[/quote]

It’s not as if it’s innovative or new anymore, wouldn’t see why not.

Read full topic

item.title: Silabsoft-Style Client
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Ruby:

PM her, she might still have an old one lying around or check out silabsoft.org for one kicking around.

She isn’t going to give her client away. I know there are clients out there that have what you’re looking for. It wouldn’t even be difficult to start from scratch. There are plenty of tutorials that will teach you how to add 474+ models into your client. Plus it is a good learning experience
